alert.note: Alert for Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 24 at 4:49PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR A DAM RELEASE IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST TUESDAY, MAY 02... * WHAT...Flooding caused by upstream dam release is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Arizona, including the following county, Yuma. * WHEN...Until 500 PM MST Tuesday May 02. * IMPACTS...Lowland flooding and inundation of unbridged crossings will occur along the Gila River downstream of Painted Rock Dam. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 439 PM MST, water being released from Painted Rock Dam continues to travel down the Gila River through Yuma County. This will likely flood unbridged river crossings and may inundate some farmland. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ligurta and Kinter. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
